title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Officer Scott MacIsaac, a Boston police officer with over 30 years of service, died of cancer diagnosed in 2025.
MacIsaac worked in various districts, including West Roxbury, and was noted for commendations during his police career.
A funeral for Officer MacIsaac is scheduled on February 5 at St. John Chrysostom Church in West Roxbury.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman and Andrei Vasilevskiy engaged in a rare goalie fight during the Bruins' outdoor game loss to Tampa Bay.
The fight occurred as over 64,000 fans watched at Raymond James Stadium, with both goalies receiving penalties.
Despite the on-ice fight, Swayman and Vasilevskiy exchanged words and hugs in the post-game handshake line.

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, is charged with the murder of Fall River residents Elizabeth and Nicholas Almedia.
Cole faces two murder and one unlawful firearm possession charges after the Fall River shootings.
Cole, reportedly dating Elizabeth, was found at the scene; arraignment set for Monday.

title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 skiers were rescued from a malfunctioning ski lift at Dartmouth Skiway in Lyme Center, New Hampshire.
Fire crews from Lyme, Hanover, and Thetford, along with police, evacuated 59 people in under 90 minutes.
One rescued skier was hospitalized, while others were checked for injuries and returned to the main lodge.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Mass. State Sen. Dean Tran sentenced to additional 11 months for obstruction of justice and false statement charges.
Tran will serve 10 months concurrently with an existing 18-month sentence; an extra month follows completion of current sentence.
Tran faced multiple charges, including fraudulent unemployment claims, ethics law violations, and firearm theft from an elderly woman.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten scored eight goals in 14 games, earning NHL Rookie of the Month for January.
Minten contributed to the Bruins' 11-2-1 record, tying for league lead with 14 points in January.
Bruins' centers, including Minten, average 21.6 years old for Sunday's game against the Lightning.

title: 7 people are presumed dead after their Gloucester fishing boat sank. Here’s how they’ll be remembered.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Seven crew members are presumed dead after their fishing boat, Lily Jean, sank off Gloucester's coast.
The U.S. Coast Guard suspended the search after covering 1,000 square miles without finding remaining crew members.
The crew included locals like Captain Gus Sanfilippo, Sean Therrien, and fisheries observer Jada Samitt.

title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins dressed as colonial-era Patriots for the Stadium Series game against the Lightning in Tampa.
Players wore tricorne hats, shoe buckles, and wigs, using costumes supplied by Boston Costume.
Nikita Zadorov said the outfits were inspired by Boston's historical ties and respect for the founding fathers.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade pitcher Jordan Hicks and prospect David Sandlin to White Sox for minor leaguer Gage Ziehl.
Hicks, part of a 2025 trade for Rafael Devers, posted an 8.20 ERA in 18.2 innings with Boston.
The trade includes cash to Chicago and is a salary move as Hicks earns $12.5 million in 2026.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Day 1 of the 'Something in the Way' music festival showcased two dozen indie bands at Roadrunner.
Performers included The Hotelier, Teen Suicide, Explosions in the Sky, and Tigers Jaw.
Boston.com photographer Ben Stas captured images of the festival for concert reviews coverage.
